title: [Large-scale] Student-Centered Social Studies Curriculum Design Project

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational grasp of social science concepts and basic collaborative skills
context.additional_context: Learners own smartphones but lack PC access, showing strong interest in social issues and career-linked learning, requiring continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can propose at least three improvement plans for social studies classes using participatory design techniques.
Learners can participate in the lesson design process at over 80% engagement through collaboration with peers and instructors.
Learners can achieve 100% participation in sharing and voting on lesson ideas using smartphone-based collaborative tools (e.g., Google Forms, KakaoTalk Open Chat).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
